domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text:
Yesterday, @DaveThroupEA tweeted a video of salmon at a weir. 

Today, with only my small lens I went to hopefully capture my first glimpse of the salmon run in the wild. 

Oh my god - just incredible. I somehow managed these photos! 

@BBCCountryfile @bbcweather @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/YWEv3V9no4

domain.name: Holiday
domain.description: Holidays like Christmas or Halloween

tweets.text:
It‚Äôs getting closer to #Halloween but we are very happy to see these creatures in the #Wandle! These invertebrates provide food for much of the wildlife we know and love. 
#LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek https://t.co/oLim8JBKzk

@creek_robert @EnvAgency @LivEchonews Hi Rob, the reserve is now open again but with barriers along the bank. This area is still unsafe so closed to visitors at the moment. You can read more here: https://t.co/KPX8CsTWRr

@Lancswildlife @EnvAgency @LivEchonews Hen Harrier reported this afternoon,
is the reserve now open? Not seen anything about area being safe again
WATCH Becca and Alice invertebrate sampling on the #Wandle #LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek https://t.co/I53WP67pbN

This October half term do your bit to keep our environment clean.

Bag up your dog poo and put it in the bin.

#BagItBinIt #BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/j0Tnipo1ro

@jamespearson88 @NickyGeeson @EnvAgencyMids @DaveThroupEA education, please, and then enforcement. It really worries me that without best info networks, farmers just feel got-at, and then go the other way. I write about river ecology and I grew up here.

NEW: Soil pollution is damaging Herefordshire's rivers and hitting fish species. 
Officers from @EnvAgencyMids are inspecting hundreds of recently harvested fields at risk from heavy rain, reminding farmers what steps they can take. Enforcement action could follow.@DaveThroupEA https://t.co/N5H3UQiaBQ

tweets.text:
Dog poo contains bacteria which can be harmful to people & wildlife. 

üíôMake sure when you are out with your dog this half term you clean up after them!

üåäKeep our water healthy for everyone, even if you're not  near a beach! 

#BagItBinIt #BinIt4Beaches #RespectProtectEnjoy https://t.co/I2vGET8kPH

tweets.text:
A very welcome announcement this morning & I'm very proud that #TeamEA are part of this important breakthrough in the fight against #COVID__19 

Thank you & well done to all colleagues & partners for working together and saving lives.

#CovidSewageTesting #coronavirus @EnvAgency https://t.co/SabOoAp7yA

Thanks everyone for making #JNCC_EO4water such a success! @BrockmannCon @PlymouthMarine @EMODnet @CefasGovUK @EnvAgency @StirUni @ScottishEPA @UniRdg_Met @geoaquawatch @DefraGovUK & of course @CopernicusEU If you missed it, the videos, slides & other resources are now available! https://t.co/B2hZ2aTsno

"We constantly innovate to do more with less. But ultimately we will get the environment we pay for. A core part of that is funding the @EnvAgency properly." 

My letter to @thetimes quoted in their article about cuts to UK regulators today. https://t.co/9qGJ8JzWBf

Full text üëá https://t.co/BNpdhz7Z8a

@CleanAirGreenUK @EnvAgency The applicant‚Äôs consultant team for Oakdown Farm have been on site for the last couple of weeks undertaking technical investigations. The technical investigations do not trigger the requirement for planning permission. (1/2)

@EnvAgency Obviously much more important than say stopping @thameswater dumping sewage into the Hogsmill River, one of only two urban chalk streams in the whole of Greater London. https://t.co/tINdhTOg2I
Hello @BasingstokeGov did you approve this digging work at the oakdown site near Junction 7 / A30? @EnvAgency : this is piling into Aquifer. Can you please check. https://t.co/8qqGBDAeoL
@RussellB1ggs @SEGandrewK @theriverstrust @N_Rivers_Trust @PondRiverStream @EnvAgencyAnglia That would be an easy fix....
@NaomiLWood @TonyJuniper @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency Recommend you visit Wales and see how the ideas of merged agencies (CCW & EA & FC) is working out.

This October half term do your bit to keep our bathing waters safe for all to enjoy! üåä 

Bag up your dog poo and put it in the bin. #BagItBinIt #BinIt4Beaches #RespectProtectEnjoy https://t.co/4sOJZp506j

Following public feedback proposals for an essential 1.1km flood wall in West Kirby have been redesigned to take on board local suggestions. Detailed plans for the new flood wall, will be officially lodged this week. https://t.co/t7H8LZLyvu @EnvAgency https://t.co/UCA4piY50Z

tweets.text:
Join our partner @Trent_R_Trust on Twitter from 12 noon tomorrow to celebrate this year's recent #WorldFishMigrationDay inc a Twitter Storm #trtlive at 12.30pm.  

Watch 60 minutes of fishy tales & find out about #fish related projects inc Oakerthorpe Brook & #DarleyAbbey #Derbys https://t.co/l8JQpd98KY

Still time to catch this on demand‚Ä¶

We pursued three waste criminals across London and surrounding counties to put two men in prison‚Ä¶   

Watch the whole story on #DefendersUK on #BBC1, and how we got the right result: https://t.co/fWkgl1MKRP https://t.co/3J9KCtAcmV

tweets.text:
#DYK that rainfall can wash dog poo into bathing waters through the surface water drains and streams, even if the dog fouls far from the beach? 
Please bag up your poo and put it in the bin. 
#BagItBinIt #BinIt4Beaches #RespectProtectEnjoy https://t.co/klqK0rNyBJ
We took @bbchw on one of our soil patrols and this is what they found... https://t.co/X2y3dLi3bH

Lunt Meadows NR is closed closed until further notice. River Alt has overtopped at the spillway as per design but has breached at 2 further points undermining the bank. Visitors should not enter from any entrance & especially not walk on the river bank @EnvAgency  @LivEchonews https://t.co/JSybmCojnd

@hertscc @Bobdeering4 @AndrewS484 @PeterRuffles @BenCrystall @SMPNewton @GreenDaar Does this look like a natural chalk stream? This is #RiverBeane at #WaterfordMarsh - we need urgent action and a properly engineered solution by the EA to #restoremolewoodmillrace https://t.co/WocVQBKYAA

@cambo691 @EnvAgency There will be a number of access points through the wall along South Parade. Each access point will be fitted with a flood gate. You can see an example around 20 seconds in on the animated illustration.
@WirralCouncil @EnvAgency Won't the water just flow through the gateway holes ..????
How it started // How it's going #SphagnumMonday https://t.co/9iRWFHbcSQ

NEW PRESS RELEASE: 1Spatial partners with @EnvAgency  and @DefraGovUK to enable automatic quality-assured and timely geoCOBie asset information delivery from suppliers

Read now: https://t.co/qeL97cIkwR

#pressrelease #dataquality https://t.co/JKXNAnjy3a

tweets.text:
From Mon 2nd Nov, road closures will be in place in #Kendal for 4 weeks to accommodate for ground investigation works to help inform the @EnvAgencyNW flood scheme design. For more details visit the Kendal page here: https://t.co/NOiwe5RTKw

#flooding #FloodAware https://t.co/CPLlAQMOvx

tweets.text:
For #LondonRiversWeek why not join @ThamesEstPart & @EnvAgencySE TOMORROW 11am to find out how both wildlife & people benefit from softening our estuary edges & creating new habitats along the tidal Thames defences
https://t.co/aU5on7BOyv
Very interesting and educational morning with the @EnvAgency on one of their regional flood exercises. Watch this space... @itvwestcountry @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/frj3tmzxDu

DEFRA's now decided to pause policymaking on reducing water demand, even though the @EnvAgency @NAOorguk , @CommonsEAC @CommonsPAC and others have been warning about it for donkeys'. No action taken or even response given to a consultation that closed more than a year ago. 2/7
